title: 'Can come to the ruling side': CM Fadnavis' offer for former ally Uddhav
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis hinted at a possible BJP-Shiv Sena (UBT) coalition, suggesting Uddhav Thackeray could join the ruling side. This remark comes amid Uddhav's criticism of the BJP and speculation about a reunion of the Thackeray cousins. MNS chief Raj Thackeray refuted claims of alliance talks with Uddhav, accusing journalists of misrepresenting his comments.

title: Israel strikes Syria military HQ, warns of ‘serious’ Sweida situation- What we know
content: Israel launched a direct strike on the Syrian military headquarters in Damascus following escalating violence against Druze civilians in southern Syria. The IDF confirmed the strike, targeting military infrastructure near the Defense Ministry, as part of a broader campaign to deter threats near Israel's northern border.

title: 'Detain me, if you can': Mamata dares BJP; accuses of 'targeting' Bengali migrants
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee launched a scathing attack on the BJP, accusing them of targeting Bengali speakers in BJP-ruled states and manipulating voter lists. She refuted allegations linking Bengali migrants to illegal immigration, challenging the BJP to prove their claims. Banerjee vowed to defend Bengali identity and resist any attempts to remove names from electoral rolls, threatening political retaliation.

title: Shocking! Ravi Shastri blames Karun Nair's 'huge lapse in concentration' for Lord's defeat
content: Ravi Shastri analyzed India's loss to England at Lord's. He highlighted Rishabh Pant's crucial dismissal before lunch. Karun Nair's wicket early in the second innings triggered a collapse. Shastri praised the lower order's fight but noted the top order's struggles. He drew parallels with India's 2021 Lord's win. Shastri remains optimistic about India's comeback in the series.

title: 'Akbar brutal, Babur ruthless': NCERT gives Mughal era a makeover; adds a no-blame footnote
content: NCERT’s new Class 8 Social Science textbook reframes medieval Indian history, including the Mughal era, with a balanced, critical lens. While detailing events like Babur’s invasions and Akbar’s conquests, it avoids assigning blame, urging students to analyse rather than judge. The textbook promotes understanding complex pasts to foster empathy, reflection, and informed citizenship in today’s learners.

title: TCS gives 100% variable pay to 70% employees; HR head says: 'Payment...'
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will provide 100% variable pay to approximately 70% of its employees up to the C2 grade for the June quarter. Variable pay for employees in the C3 grade and above will be determined by the performance of their respective business units.

title: IND vs ENG: Chucking or correct action?: Bumrah's untold story revealed
content: Jasprit Bumrah, the world's leading Test bowler, maintains his dominance with a significant lead in the rankings. His unique action, initially questioned by others, was identified by his childhood coach as a natural weapon. The coach advised him to retain his original style, which proved crucial in shaping Bumrah's successful career.

title: 'No anti-national statements': Rijiju's advice to Rahul over foreign policy remarks
content: Kiren Rijiju responded to Rahul Gandhi's criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's foreign policy. Rijiju accused Gandhi of speaking against the nation and using the language of Pakistan. He defended the Prime Minister's foreign policy decisions. Rijiju also mentioned upcoming Parliament session. He said that the government is open to discussion.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Nimisha death sentence case: 'Insist on implementing God's law' - what Yemen family said
content: The family of Talal Abdo Mahdi seeks justice in the Nimisha Priya case. They demand 'Qisas' under God's Law. Yemen postponed Priya's execution. Hope rests on indemnity settlement with the deceased's family. Priya was convicted in 2020 for Mahdi's murder. She is imprisoned in Sana'a. Paying 'blood money' is the only option to save Priya.

title: 'Udaipur files': Supreme Court defers hearing to July 21
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the Centre committee to promptly decide on the release and certification of 'Udaipur Files,' acknowledging the filmmakers' urgency. This decision follows concerns raised about the film's potential impact on a fair trial and its portrayal of a specific community.

title: Pant's run out, lone century, Stokes' victim: KL Rahul breaks silence on Lord's heartbreak
content: Following India's 22-run defeat to England in the Lord's Test, KL Rahul reflected on the loss, emphasizing the valuable lessons learned. Ravi Shastri highlighted Rishabh Pant's run-out and Karun Nair's dismissal as pivotal moments that shifted the game's momentum.

title: AI wars: Nvidia CEO Huang calls Chinese AI models “world class”; one ‘banned’ by the US government
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praised Chinese AI models as "world class" at a Beijing expo, highlighting their open-source approach and global impact. This endorsement comes as Nvidia resumes H20 chip sales to China, signaling an easing of trade tensions.

title: US secondary tariff threat may sour India’s love affair with Russian oil
content: The US threat of tariffs on countries buying Russian oil could disrupt India's discounted oil imports. These tariffs, aimed at penalizing Russia for the Ukraine war, may extend to countries importing Russian oil, impacting India's exports to the US. India may need to shift to pricier West Asian and Brazilian oil if the threat materializes.

title: Kyle Schwarber makes history: first Phillies All-Star MVP since 1964
content: Kyle Schwarber delivered a historic performance at the 2025 MLB All-Star Game, securing the MVP award with a clutch swing-off victory. His three consecutive home runs in the tiebreaker propelled the National League to a 7-6 win over the American League. This win marks the first time a Phillies player has won the All-Star Game MVP since 1964.

title: Magic Johnson and his wife Cookie Johnson wrap up vacation time in style
content: Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, recently concluded their European vacation, sharing joyful moments with family and friends on Instagram. The trip included stops in Monaco, Croatia, Portofino, and Cannes, filled with fine dining, attending plays, and yacht retreats. Magic emphasized family time, posting a group photo with his children and grandchildren, highlighting his role as a dedicated family man.

title: Don Cherry comments on immigrants; Ron MacLean calls it an orchestrated exit strategy
content: Don Cherry was fired from Hockey Night in Canada in 2019 for controversial comments about immigrants and Remembrance Day poppies. Ron MacLean, his former co-host, suggested Cherry's remarks were a deliberate exit strategy following a pneumonia scare. Cherry denies MacLean's claims, expressing disappointment and stating he has no desire to discuss the matter further with MacLean.

title: IND vs ENG: Dinesh Karthik shuts down speculation : 'I took Jitesh to ...'
content: A video showing cricketer Jitesh Sharma seemingly shouting at Dinesh Karthik during commentary went viral, prompting Karthik to clarify the situation on X, dismissing social media trolls. Karthik explained he invited Jitesh to the commentary box.

title: Rahul in Assam: ‘CM acts like king, but people will jail him’; vows Congress comeback
content: Rahul Gandhi, accompanied by Mallikarjun Kharge, is visiting Guwahati to invigorate the Assam Congress ahead of the 2026 elections. Gandhi accused chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of corruption, predicting his eventual imprisonment by the people's will. He also alleged BJP's manipulation of voter lists, and emphasised the ideological battle between the RSS and Congress.

title: Op Sindoor: CDS says 'yesterday’s weapons can’t win today’s wars'
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan revealed that India successfully countered Pakistan's drone and loitering munition attacks during Operation Sindoor without any damage. He emphasized the revolutionary impact of UAVs in warfare and the critical need for indigenous counter-drone technology. Chauhan highlighted the importance of reducing reliance on foreign OEMs and promoting self-reliance in defense, aligning with the Aatmanirbhar Bharat vision.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: Fauja Singh hit-and-run: NRI says he learnt victim’s ID from TV news
content: Amritpal Singh Dhillon, the driver in the hit-and-run case that resulted in the death of Fauja Singh, claimed he only realized who he had hit after seeing news reports. Dhillon, who fled the scene, has been arrested and charged with culpable homicide and rash driving.

title: Cricket | ‘He’s at Tendulkar, Kohli level’: What England fans are saying about Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who shot to fame by becoming the youngest player and century-maker in the Indian Premier League earlier this year, has lit up the English shores with his swashbuckling batting. The southpaw has already become a crowd-puller and, if cricket analyst Daniel Peacock is to be believed, the teenager has the ability to match Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli – or go beyond.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence after Azealia Banks exposes X rated photos
content: Azealia Banks ignited a social media storm by claiming Conor McGregor, celebrating his birthday in Italy, sent her nude photos. Instead of directly addressing the allegations, McGregor responded to a fan's joke with a political comment about Irish politics. Banks further alleged a long history of nude exchanges and harassment, while McGregor continued posting from his yacht, seemingly unfazed.

title: 'You don't need dictionary': SC relaxes bail conditions for Ashoka University professor
content: The Supreme Court has questioned the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing Professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad's social media posts, specifically regarding the seizure of his devices. Justices Surya Kant and Dipankar Datta directed the SIT to confine its investigation to the two FIRs and complete it within four weeks.

title: Chhangur Baba breaks silence; Rs 100 crore property trail under scanner
content: Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, the alleged mastermind of an illegal religious conversion syndicate, and his aide Nasreen, have been taken into custody by the Uttar Pradesh ATS. The investigation has expanded to Maharashtra and districts along the Indo-Nepal border, with authorities tracing properties worth over Rs 100 crore.

title: Cricket: With ‘Naushad uncle’ guiding him, England U19 captain Hamza slams century in Youth Test
content: Hamza Shaikh, England's Under-19 captain, was struggling with his form. He then trained with Naushad Khan in Birmingham. Naushad is the father and coach of Sarfaraz and Musheer Khan. After the training, Shaikh scored three fifties. He also scored 84 and 112 in the first Youth Test against India. Naushad provided technical and mental guidance.

title: 27 all out! IPL to blame? Lara makes a massive comment on WI cricket's decline
content: Following West Indies' humiliating defeat in the third Test against Australia, succumbing to a historic low score of 27, Cricket West Indies president has called for an emergency meeting. Legends like Sir Clive Lloyd, Sir Vivian Richards, and Brian Lara have been invited to address the crisis.

title: Ronnie Coleman's medical episode- credits daughter for saving his life
content: Ronnie Coleman, the legendary bodybuilder, recently faced a life-threatening battle with sepsis, a severe medical condition triggered by an infection. Coleman credits his 13-year-old daughter's quick action for saving his life during the ordeal. Now recovering, he's partnering with the Sepsis Alliance to raise awareness about this dangerous condition, highlighting the importance of early detection and treatment.

title: Gujarat horror: Man wanting a son throws 7-year-old daughter into canal
content: In Kapadvanj, a man allegedly threw his seven-year-old daughter into a canal due to his desire for a male heir. Vijay Solanki took his wife and daughter to a temple before committing the crime near the Narmada canal. Initially, the wife reported it as an accident, but later revealed the truth to her family after the body was found.

title: Where is D Gukesh? World Champion skips Vegas Freestyle Chess
content: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa is set to clash with world champion Magnus Carlsen in the Freestyle Chess tournament in New Delhi. Arjun Erigaisi and Vidit Gujrathi are in the other group. The event features a $750,000 prize pool and a unique format where piece positions are randomized.

title: Julie Cousins sobs as Falcons bench Kirk in Netflix’s ‘Quarterback’
content: In Netflix's Quarterback Season 2, Julie Cousins shares the emotional impact of Kirk Cousins being benched for Michael Penix Jr. Despite the difficult news, Kirk displayed remarkable grace by calling Penix to congratulate him. This act of empathy resonated with fans, highlighting the Cousins' resilience and Kirk's exceptional character amidst a challenging transition within the Atlanta Falcons.

title: 'Precautionary measure': Displaced Manipuris returning to their villages stopped
content: Manipur authorities halted nearly 100 internally displaced people from returning to their villages near Sajiwa, Imphal East, citing precautionary measures. This action follows the ethnic conflict between the Meitei and Kuki communities, which has displaced thousands since May 2023.

title: UP teacher questions kanwar yatra; booked for promoting enmity
content: A government school teacher in Bareilly, UP, faces legal trouble after a video surfaced showing him reciting a poem during a school assembly that allegedly disparaged the Kanwar Yatra. The teacher is accused of promoting enmity between groups, leading to a police investigation and a complaint filed by a right-wing activist.

title: Israeli man seeks custody of daughters found living in Karnataka cave
content: After an artist and her two daughters were discovered living in a cave in India, the children's father, Dror Goldstein, has requested shared custody. Nina Kutina, the mother, claims they lived a self-sufficient and happy life in the forest, despite officials' concerns.

title: Viral video: Kanye West calls pro-Palestinian supporters 'programmed'
content: Kanye West's recent video, where he labels pro-Palestine supporters as "programmed" and likens them to Trump opponents, has ignited controversy. West's remarks, filled with offensive language, have been criticized for dismissing genuine activism and minimizing the suffering in Gaza. This incident adds to West's history of contentious political statements, including past support for Donald Trump and antisemitic comments.

title: Heartbreak for Team India at Lord's ... and a new Test No.1 steals the spotlight
content: Joe Root is now number one in ICC Test Batting rankings. He performed well in the Lord's Test. England won against India. Steve Smith also improved his ranking. Scott Boland achieved a career-best sixth position. Shamar Joseph and Washington Sundar also saw ranking improvements. Nuwan Thushara and Rishad Hossain made significant jumps in T20I rankings.

title: Nimisha Priya death sentence: How Blood Money payment works under Sharia Law?
content: Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse, faces execution in Yemen for murder. The execution is stayed. Her fate hinges on 'blood money', compensation to the victim's family under Sharia law. Sharia guides Muslim life, influencing legal systems in many Muslim-majority nations. Blood money offers a path to avoid execution, though outcomes vary.

title: 'Chaddi-baniyan gang': Oppn stages unique protest against Sena MLAs - Watch video
content: Maharashtra's opposition protested against Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad for allegedly assaulting a canteen worker over stale food. Opposition MLAs wore vests and towels, referencing Gaikwad's viral video where he was seen in similar attire during the assault.

title: 'Erasure of history': Satyajit Ray's ancestral house taken down in Bangladesh
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has criticized the Bangladesh government for allegedly demolishing Satyajit Ray's ancestral house in Dhaka, calling it an erasure of history and Bengali heritage. The proposed demolition by Shishu Academy to construct a multi-storey facility has sparked controversy.

title: Passan: All-Star Game swing-off captures the beauty of baseball
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Sources: Oakmont bars Clark over locker damage
content: Oakmont Country Club has banned golfer Wyndham Clark from its property after he damaged his locker following a missed cut at last month's U.S. Open, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Belichick pushes back on Kraft: Pats job 'big risk'
content: On the heels of comments by Robert Kraft, Bill Belichick says he was the one who took the risk to join the Patriots in 1999.

title: Schwarber lifts NL in 1st ASG home run swing-off
content: Phillies slugger Kyle Schwarber made history by pulverizing three home runs on three swings in the first swing-off to decide an All-Star Game, giving the National League a win over the AL after the teams were tied through nine innings.

title: Schauffele offloads trophies, unsure where gold is
content: Xander Schauffele, who counts two majors and a Tour Championship among his victories, gives his trophies to his parents, and he's "not sure" where his Olympic gold medal is.

title: Clark leaves with groin injury late in Fever win
content: Caitlin Clark was visibly emotional on the bench after suffering an apparent groin injury in the final minute of the Fever's win over the Sun on Tuesday night.

title: MLB re-creates Aaron's record 715th HR at ASG
content: Major League Baseball honored Hall of Famer Hank Aaron by re-creating his 715th home run through projection mapping and pyrotechnics Tuesday night.

title: Amid hype, Manning keen to 'play ball,' prove self
content: While the frenzy around Arch Manning continued at SEC media days, the Texas QB realizes he hasn't proved anything on the field in Austin as he readies for his first full season at the Longhorns' starter.

title: NBA explores expansion: 'Nothing predetermined'
content: The NBA is one step closer on the long road to expansion, but Adam Silver cautioned that "nothing has been predetermined."

title: Who are the NFL's best wide receivers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the top 10 receivers in the NFL? Execs, coaches and scouts rank Ja'Marr Chase, Justin Jefferson and other stars.

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: What are the most important positional battles and injuries to monitor at NFL training camps? Ben Solak gives his picks.

title: B- for the Fever? A- for Valkyries? Grading every WNBA team at midseason
content: The Valkyries join the Lynx and Mercury near the front of the class, while the Fever and Sky have improved marks.

title: What to expect from Rory and Scottie, and how will Royal Portrush play?
content: Is Scottie Scheffler the overwhelming favorite? Is Rory McIlroy's game rounding into form? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the Open Championship.

title: 2025 MLB draft recap: Best picks, biggest steals and analysis for all 30 teams
content: Now that all 20 rounds are complete, it's time to see what Kiley McDaniel makes of your team's draft haul.

title: 'Boxing is my passion': Why a 46-year-old Pacquiao is fighting again
content: Manny Pacquiao is back to a familiar place in Los Angeles, looking for a new start and to add to his legendary career.

title: Building Duke's all-time roster: Does Cooper Flagg make the cut?
content: Some names were obvious (Hill, Laettner). Others sparked a debate (Flagg, Williamson). But we think we got the all-time roster right.

title: X factors for every Top 25 team: What could make (or break) the season
content: Every team has a key player, position group or situation that could swing its season. We break them all down.

title: Ranking CFB's best coaches, from Ryan Day and Dabo Swinney to ... Rhett Lashlee?
content: Is Ryan Day a genius or could anyone win at Ohio State? We break down 20 years of sideline overachievers.

title: Richards is delivering on his immense potential for the USMNT, Palace
content: Chris Richards has long been expected to be a pillar of the USMNT's 2026 World Cup, but only now is he delivering on that promise.

title: Alexander-Arnold transformed Liverpool. Will he do the same for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold left the Premier League as one of its best players ever. Whether he can reach similar heights in LaLiga as a Real Madrid player will be fascinating to watch.

title: Source: Liverpool make approach for striker Isak
content: Liverpool have registered their interest in signing Newcastle United forward Alexander Isak this summer as they continue their search for a No.9, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Bellingham out 12 weeks post-surgery
content: Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham will undergo surgery on his left shoulder in London on Wednesday, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ter Stegen trains alone, Barça future in doubt
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Marc-André ter Stegen has been training on his own since the club's return to preseason on Sunday amid continued uncertainty over his future.

title: Sources: NWSL's Denver close to hiring Cushing
content: Denver's 2026 NWSL expansion team is close to finalizing the hire of Nick Cushing as the club's first head coach, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Agyemang seals move to Championship side Derby
content: Derby County has signed Charlotte FC and United States striker Patrick Agyemang, the Championship side announced on Tuesday.

title: USMNT, LAFC's Long (Achilles) out for season
content: LAFC and USMNT defender Aaron Long will miss the rest of the season after having surgery to repair a ruptured left Achilles.

title: Sources: MLS players got boost in CWC money
content: MLS players reached an agreement with the league to secure an increase in prize money received from the FIFA Club World Cup, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Best NFL teams of the past 25 years, ranked from 25 to 1
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the MLB season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Behind the scenes with a heavyweight champion
content: ESPN goes behind the scenes in camp with Oleksandr Usyk ahead of his undisputed heavyweight title fight against Daniel Dubois on July 19.

title: Euro 2025 Power Rankings: Spain still the favorite, England a close second
content: Euro 2025 is down to the final eight teams who have the chance to get their hands on the trophy in Switzerland. We ranked them in order.

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to rival Arsenal for Real Madrid's Rodrygo
content: Talks are set to be held between Liverpool and Real Madrid regarding a move for winger Rodrygo. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: More such party convention will be organised in North Karnataka, says Minister
content: Shivanand Patil clarifies that the Congress convention in Mysuru is not a show of strength in favour of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: State to produce antivenom locally, says Saseendran
content: State aims to achieve zero deaths due to snakebites by 2030 as part of the Snake Envenomation Zero Mortality Kerala project, says Forest Minister

title: Sixth edition of Kochi-Muziris Biennale titled ‘For the Time Being’, to get under way on December 12
content: Curated by artist Nikhil Chopra with HH Art Spaces, a Goa-based artist-led organisation, the biennale will run for 110 days till March 31, 2026

title: Terrorist killed recently in Basantgarh was top JeM commander Haider: Jammu and Kashmir DGP
content: Asserting that the security forces are continuing their operations to neutralise terrorists, the DGP highlighted the good relations between police and public

title: Focus on enhancing learning outcomes, developing fundamental skills among students, Andhra Pradesh HRD Minister Lokesh tells officials
content: Lokesh also directs officials to maintain utmost transparency in selecting candidates for ‘Best Teacher’ awards and complete development of Skill Portal by August

title: 227 candidates to receive degrees at IIT Dharwad convocation on Saturday
content: Union Secretary of Science and Technology Abhay Karandikar to deliver convocation address at the sixth annual convocation of the institute

title: Attendant ‘caught stealing’ cash from hundi at Srisailam temple
content: The accused has been removed from his duties with immediate effect and ₹24,220 cash recovered, said an official release from the temple

title: Assam Chief Minister will go to jail for graft, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma hit back at Rahul Gandhi, saying the Congress MP is out on bail for criminal cases across the country

title: Newly-elected BJP, AAP MLAs take oath in Gujarat Assembly
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel and several ministers attended Mr. Chavda’s oath-taking ceremony in the House

title: AIKKMS condemns Congress govt. for planning to ‘buy land from those willing to sell’
content: The All India Kisan Khet Majdoor Sangathan has welcomed the State government’s decision to drop land acquisition at Devanahalli

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu seeks Centre support for setting up world-class badminton training centre in Amaravati
content: In a meeting with Union Minister for Sports Mansukh Mandaviya, the Chief Minister highlights the need to establish a national water sports training hub in Amaravati, additional Khelo India Centres, and a SAI training centre in Tirupati

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: INLD chief Abhay Chautala gets death threat, son Karan lodges police complaint
content: In his complaint, Mr. Karan said he then received a voice note from a foreign number in which the unknown person used inappropriate language against his father

title: Second season paddy crop in Alappuzha faces black bug threat
content: Presence of the pest confirmed in Punnapra, Nedumudi, Kainakary, Champakulam. The pest injures leaves and midribs, causing leaves to tear off and midribs to wilt. Officials suggest controlled flooding of fields to help destroy the pest

title: Madras High Court restrains recitation of Nama Sankeerthanam in residential locality without Collector’s permission
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, it is time people understand that “peace is the best prayer and silence the greatest prayer”

title: T.N. CM Stalin rolls out ₹433-crore development package in Mayiladuthurai
content: The announcement signals a major thrust in infrastructure, welfare delivery, and coastal development

title: Rifiness Warjri becomes Meghalaya’s youngest person to conquer Mt Everest, aims for seven summits
content: “My roots keep me grounded… the mountains teach us humility,” says the 20-year-old mountaineer as she inspires with grit, grace, and dreams of conquering seven summits

title: 2026 Tamil Nadu elections will mark a permanent farewell to Edappadi Palaniswami: CM Stalin
content: “Mr. Palaniswami says ‘Tata, bye bye’ to me. But since 2019, the people of Tamil Nadu have been saying the same to him. In the upcoming elections, it will be a permanent goodbye,” Mr. Stalin remarked.

title: Satheesan writes to Kerala CM, seeks solution to crisis in higher education sector
content: The government should remember that petty power politics and violent protests in Kerala University and the higher education sector is affecting the academic prospects of students, says Leader of the Opposition

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Government to introduce eight new Bills
content: Among the Bills planned for the Monsoon Ssession are the National Sports Governance Bill, the Geoheritage Sites and Geo-relics (Preservation and Maintenance) Bill, the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Amendment Bill and the National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill

title: Revised normalisation pattern planned for KEAM from next academic year: Minister R. Bindu
content: The pattern had to be put on hold after the Kerala High Court annulled the original rank list and instructed the government to revert to the previous normalisation method. The State government decided against going in appeal since the AICTE mandated that all admission procedures be completed by August 14

title: Colonel assault case: Punjab and Haryana HC transfers probe to CBI
content: The petitioner submitted that the Chandigarh Police had "failed" to conduct a free and fair investigation in the case.

title: Medical council in Kerala removes doctor’s name from register for three months for using unregistered qualifications
content: A penalty of ₹1 lakh too imposed on doctor practising in Thiruvananthapuram. He was asked to remove qualifications from nameboard and fined ₹50,000  in 2022. However, he paid only the fine.

title: Sivaganga custodial death victim’s brother urges Madurai Collector to expedite death certificate issuance
content: In his petition, Mr. Naveen Kumar, 27, stated that since the post-mortem of Ajith Kumar was conducted at Government Rajaji Hospital, the family had been trying to obtain the death certificate from the hospital administration

title: Gujarat's Banni Grasslands ready to host cheetahs, say officials
content: Mr. Singh said a 600-hectare enclosure has been developed, the herbivore population has been increased, and facilities such as CCTV monitoring and a dedicated veterinary centre have been established

title: ₹100 crore allocated for Ghatkesar-Yadagirigutta MMTS extension; MP Chamala thanks Ministry of Railways
content: Union Minister of State for (Railways) Ravneet Singh said the ₹100 crore allocation for the current financial year would depend on the progress of the work and the demand from the executing agency

title: Mamata Banerjee leads protest march in Kolkata, warns BJP of ‘dire political backlash’ if it doesn’t stop 'harassing' Bengali-speaking people
content: Similar demonstrations have also been organised by the TMC in the district headquarter towns across the State

title: Rahul does not know 'F' of foreign policy but keeps raising questions: BJP
content: When our Foreign Minister goes to China for the SCO meeting and if he does not meet his Chinese counterpart and the country's president, then who will he meet? Italy's Prime Minister?, questions BJP leader Ajay Alok

title: AIADMK will secure absolute majority and form government in 2026, reiterates Palaniswami
content: Having aligned with the BJP for the 1999 Lok Sabha and 2001 Assembly elections and shared power at the Centre (1999-2003), the DMK has no locus standi to criticise the AIADMK’s alliance with the national party for the 2026 Assembly election, he said

title: Union Cabinet hails Shubhanshu Shukla's space odyssey
content: The Cabinet, at a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, adopted a resolution that termed Shukla's space journey as a moment of pride, glory and joy for the entire nation

title: Congress seeks Odisha CM's resignation over college student's death in Balasore, imposition of President's Rule
content: PM Modi had himself earlier demanded imposition of President's Rule in Rajasthan, alleging women and girls were not safe in the State, says Mahila Congress chief Alka Lamba

title: Madras High Court begins final hearing on plea to vacate Tambaram Police Commissionerate from rented property
content: Property owners accuse the Police department of having put up unauthorised constructions on the terrace and car parking area

title: Congress OBC Advisory Council adopts Bengaluru Declaration, seeks national caste census
content: The OBC Advisory Council of the Congress party demanded breaking the 50% cap in providing reservation, thereby ensuring suitable reservation for the OBCs, in education, service, political and other areas

title: Cabinet clears PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana with annual outlay of ₹24,000 crore
content: Union Cabinet approves PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana, a 6-year scheme to benefit 1.7 crore farmers with ₹24,000 crore outlay

title: Labour Minister Santosh Lad tells banks to be considerate during loan recovery in Karnataka
content: Labour Minister and Dharwad district-in-charge Santosh Lad asked banks to take into consideration genuine reasons for delay in repayment

title: Chhattisgarh logged 1,301 cybercrime cases in 18 months, victims lost ₹107 crore
content: In 1,301 cybercrime cases in the last one-and-a-half years, victims have lost ₹107 crore, police have recovered ₹3.36 crore in these cases, says Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Sharma i

title: Repairs on U.K. fighter jet grounded in Kerala enter final stages, aircraft refuelled
content: Though U.K. authorities have not officially communicated the status of the maintenance works and the jet’s likely departure to U.K., it is expected that the aircraft can be taken back to its base station in the fourth week of July

title: Who is Sheikh Abubakr Ahmad, ‘the Grand Mufti of India’, who helped defer Nimisha Priya’s execution in Yemen?
content: The scheduled execution of Indian nurse Nimisha Priya in Yemen was halted following a last-minute intervention by Sheikh Abubakr Ahmad

title: A.P. firm inks pact with AICTE to offer online courses to students, professionals
content: This collaboration is aimed at delivering high-quality, accessible, and industry-aligned online courses to students, professionals, and institutions across India.

title: Supreme Court relaxes bail condition of Ashoka University professor, questions SIT line of probe
content: The Supreme Court directed that there is no need for Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad, accused of making contentious social media posts on Operation Sindoor, to appear before the SIT any further

title: Kerala’s Women and Child Development dept ropes in its school counsellors in fight against substance abuse
content: 1,012 school psychosocial counsellors being equipped to identify substance abuse early and refer students for counselling, deaddiction, and rehabilitation

title: Restore Jammu & Kashmir’s Statehood: Rahul Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge to PM Modi
content: Ahead of the Monsoon session of Parliament, the two Congress leaders in their letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the government to bring legislation restoring full Statehood to the Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir

title: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister woos aerospace firms after Karnataka shelves plan to acquire land following protest by farmers
content: The Karnataka government bowed to sustained opposition from farmers who were set to lose land for the aerospace park project

title: Opposition turns heat on AINRC-BJP combine in Puducherry
content: The BJP and its ruling ally the AINRC, headed by Chief Minister N. Rangasamy, has been under criticism following the contentious decision to replace the sole BJP Minister from the Scheduled Caste community with a party legislator who had come under the scanner of the High Court and the Puducherry police in a temple land grab case

title: Union Government selects 24 part-time National Medical Commission members
content: Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda took part in the appointment process of part-time members of NMC, autonomous boards and the search committee on Tuesday (July 15, 2025.)

title: Rahul Gandhi speaks to Odisha college student's father, assures support in fight for justice
content: In his voice, I felt his daughter's pain, dreams, and struggle, assured him that the Congress and I stand with them at every step, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Prada technical team visits Kolhapuri chappal artisans, takes samples, gifted original design similar to their controversial leather sandals
content: The four-member team included Prada’s footwear division’s pattern making manager and the director of men’s technical and production department

title: Lack of toilets in courts: Supreme Court anguished over non-filing of reports by many HCs
content: In January, the Supreme Court asked High Courts, State governments and UTs to ensure the availability of separate toilet facilities in all court premises and tribunals

title: Indian embassy in Iran advises its citizens against non-essential travel to Iran
content: The Indian embassy in Iran also advised the citizens to continue to monitor the latest regional developments and follow updated advisories issued by the Indian authorities before visiting Iran

title: Mandatory Biometric Update of Aadhaar to be launched in Telangana Inter Colleges
content: According to DoP, the Mandatory Biometric Update (MBU) of Aadhaar is a critical requirement for students to ensure accuracy in their biometric data in the age group of 15-17 years

title: SHO suspended for dereliction of duty in connection with Gopal Khemka's murder
content: Gandhi Maidan PS SHO was suspended for dereliction of duty in connection with the murder of industrialist Gopal Khemka, says Patna SSP Kartikeya K Sharma

title: Four U.P. power officials booked after boy loses hands due to electrocution
content: According to the FIR, 7-year-old  Taimur suffered grievous injuries after he touched the dangling 11,000-volt power line near Noida on May 22, 2025.

title: Water Resources Department to establish separate wing to oversee dam safety and rehabilitation measures
content: Tamil Nadu has nearly 128 dams, including 90 under the WRD and 38 under Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (Tangedco)

title: Supreme Court notice to NIA on man's plea arrested for aiding persons accused of terrorist activities
content: The prosecution had told the High Court that Manoori was allegedly planning to provide vehicles to certain persons who had been trained in Pakistan for carrying out terrorist activities, including bomb blasts

title: Supreme Court defers ‘Udaipur Files’ case hearing till July 21, awaits outcome of Centre’s decision
content: Section 6 of the Cinematograph Act empowers the Centre to call for the records of the Central Board of Film Certification of a film, and even ‘uncertify’ a certified film across or in any part of the country, or suspend its distribution

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Bombay HC dismisses PIL against Prada; questions petitioners’ right to sue
content: The plea had said the Kolhapuri chappal is protected as a Geographical Indication under the Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration and Protection) Act.

title: TVK to host second State conference in Madurai on August 25
content: Last year, on October 27, the party hosted its inaugural State conference at V. Salai near Vikkravandi in Villupuram district

title: Donald Trump's claims on India-Pakistan 'ceasefire': PM Modi must answer in Parliament, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "Today the score stands at 66 days, 23 reiterations. The score will no doubt change. The nation wants to know"

title: Opposition stages ‘banian towel’ protest against Sena MLA
content: ‘The assault by Sanjay Gaikwad in the MLA canteen shows that even the government is backing such elements’

title: Secunderabad Cantonment | Ramannakunta lake beautification gets green signal; ten sites proposed for open gyms
content: The SCB has approved the installation of open gym equipment across various residential colonies and parks

title: Kerala Home department endorses SPC’s report on Thrissur Pooram ‘disruption’ controversy
content: The then State Police Chief’s report states that a sequence of preventable oversights on the part of State law enforcement and certain sections of temple management contributed to public dissatisfaction over conduct of Thrissur Pooram ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections

title: Cattle smuggler held after encounter in Haryana's Palwal
content: The accused,  Irsad, has  16 criminal cases, including attempt to murder, cow slaughter, animal cruelty, and attack on police registered against him.

title: BJP MLA booked in murder of rowdy in Bengaluru over land dispute
content: The police registered a case against former Minister Byrathi Basavaraj; he has been added as accused number 5 in the FIR

title: After 12-year exile, 29 Tribal families to return home in Gujarat
content: The Banaskantha police initiated a meticulous process of reconciliation, and held multiple meetings with village elders, panchayat members, and community leaders to ensure a peaceful homecoming

title: Self-reliance in UAVs, counter-unmanned aerial systems strategic imperative for India: CDS Chauhan
content: Gen Chauhan said Operation Sindoor has shown why indigenously developed Unmanned Aerial Systems and C-UAS "built for our terrain and our needs are crucial".

title: "If You Want To Come Over...": Devendra Fadnavis' 'Invite' To Uddhav Thackeray
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis sparked much merriment in the state assembly today with his public invitation to Uddhav Thackeray to cross over - suggestion Mr Thackeray and his party stonily ignored.

title: Netanyahu Urges Israeli Druze To Stay Back As IDF Launches Operations In Syria
content: In a direct message to the Druze community of Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has urged restraint and warned against crossing into Syrian territory, amid escalating violence in the southwestern Syrian city of Sweida.

title: Indian Student Jailed For 35 Months In Singapore Over Construction Worker's Death: Report
content: A 22-year-old Indian student was on Wednesday sentenced to 35 months in prison for causing the death of a fellow Indian national by pushing him into the river while intoxicated.

title: No Intention To Offend Anyone: UP Teacher After Case Over Kanwar Yatra Song
content: A teacher in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district has issued a video statement expressing regret after a police case against him over a song referencing the ongoing Kanwar yatra.

title: Navy Shares Glimpses Of First Homegrown Nistar-Class Diving Support Vessel
content: The Indian Navy has shared the first glimpse of its upcoming Nistar-class Diving Support Vessel (DSV). The indigenously built vessel, constructed by Hindustan Shipyard Limited (HSL) in Visakhapatnam, is designed to support underwater missions.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can India And China Be 'Frenemies'?
content: The question that needs to be asked is, why did China risk a major conflict with India? What was the purpose? Was it to force India to come to the negotiating table, as Mao had told his generals in October 1962?

title: Elon Musk's Tesla Debuts in Mumbai, Model Y Seen Near Local Train
content: Tesla's much-awaited India debut came after long negotiations with the Indian government over pricing and import duties.

title: For Booking Ranthambore Safari, Rajasthan's New Fool-Proof Website
content: Booking a safari to Rajasthan's Ranthambore Tiger Reserve just got easier with the launch of the forest department's new website for Ranthambore -- forestrajasthan.com.

title: Rain In Parts Of Delhi, Weather Office Issues Yellow Alert
content: Delhi recorded a minimum temperature of 24.5 degrees Celsius, three notches below the season's normal. The maximum temperature is expected to settle at 34 degrees Celsius.The relative humidity was 89 per cent and the air quality was satisfactory.

title: Britain Ends 5-Year Ban On Pakistani Airlines
content: Britain has lifted restrictions on Pakistani airlines, the UK embassy in Islamabad said on Wednesday, ending a five-year ban on the country's beleaguered national carrier.

title: 25 Students Fall Ill After Consuming Mid-Day Meal In Karnataka School
content: At least 25 students fell ill after consuming a mid-day meal at the Government Lower Primary School in Karnataka.

title: 2 Instagram Influencers Arrested For Abusive, Obscene Content In UP
content: Two Instagram influencers from Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal have been arrested for creating and circulating obscene and abusive content on social media. The duo, Mehak and Pari, have a significant following online.

title: Trump Credits Melania For Shifting Perspective On Putin Over Ukraine War
content: US President Donald Trump has said that First Lady Melania Trump played a key role in shifting his perspective on Russian leaderVladimir Putin, especially on the ongoing war in Ukraine.

title: "Real Boss": Stray Dog Blocks Lamborghini On Mumbai Street, Video Goes Viral
content: A video of a street dog blocking the path of a Lamborghini Huracan supercar on a Mumbai street has made its way to X (formerly Twitter) and amused people on the platform.

title: "1 Country, 2 Laws?" Digvijaya Singh's Kanwar Yatra Post Sparks Row
content: Sharing two pictures - one where a Kanwar Yatra is blocking a road and the other where people are offering namaz - Congress MP and former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Digvijaya Singh followed it up with a provocative question.

title: 'Old Weapons Can't Win New Wars': Defence Chief On Indigenous Drone Tech
content: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Anil Chauhan on Wednesday underscored the critical transformation in modern warfare, calling for a robust indigenous drone and counter-UAV capability to meet future challenges.

title: Mamata Banerjee's March In Rain Over 'Harassment' Of Bengali Migrants
content: With the Election Commission gearing up for a Special Intensive Revision of voter lists in West Bengal, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has claimed that people whose names are not on the voters' list will be jailed

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Recovering Well After Historic Space Mission
content: India's astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla emerged from the 'Grace' crew Dragon space capsule with a smile on his face, but as was expected he was assisted by attendants as he stood up and gingerly walked out.

title: India Achieves 50% Green Energy Milestone, 5 Years Ahead Of Paris Agreement Target
content: India has hit a major clean energy milestone, achieving 50 per cent of its installed electricity capacity from non-fossil fuel sources, five years ahead of the 2030 target set under the Paris Agreement.

title: "New Chapter...": Cabinet Praises Shubhanshu Shukla's Historic ISS Mission
content: The Union Cabinet praised the return of Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla from his historic 18-day mission aboard the International Space Station (ISS), describing it as a moment of "pride, glory, and joy" for the nation.

title: FIFA reveals details to apply for World Cup tickets
content:
Applications for tickets for the 2026 World Cup open Sept. 10, FIFA said Tuesday. The next edition of the tournament, which will be co-hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States, kicks off at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City on June 11. Soccer's world governing body FIFA said that due to anticipated high demand tickets would be released in phases. -  World Cup lessons from Club World Cup 
-  Club World Cup takeaways 
-  Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC It did not say if it would use dynamic pricing, as was the case for the Club World Cup, which saw ticket prices fluctuate wildly. "We're looking forward to welcoming the world back to North America, as Canada, Mexico and the United States host what will be the biggest and greatest sporting event ever," FIFA president Gianni Infantino said in a statement. "We encourage fans everywhere to get ready to secure their place -- these will be the most coveted seats in world sport."

title: The NBA's Apron Club: Who's in, who's out and when OKC might join

title: Who has the edge for MVP, Cy Young and more? MLB Awards Watch at the All-Star break

title: Check out all the 2025 ESPYS candidates and vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Man United bring back classic '90s 'snowflake' away kit for 2025-26
